ygData.subject: Re: (no subject)
ygData.msgSnippet: If you cannot actually go to your guild and train in it, then your best bet is to assign Sneak a hot key, and hit it every 15 seconds, or whatever, all day,
ygData.messageBody:
If you cannot actually go to your guild and train in it, then your best bet
is to assign Sneak a hot key, and hit it every 15 seconds, or whatever, all
day, everyday, till you gain sufficient skill to Sneak reliably.
-----Original Message-----
From: TRAVISL <TRAVIS@...>
To: 'Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com' <Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, April 13, 1999 6:17 AM
Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Re: (no subject)


>From: TRAVISL <TRAVIS@...>
>
>How do you train in it? My guild screen does not list it as a trainable
>skill? It seems more like a "racial ability" sort of like infra-vision.
>That is the crux of my question!
>
>Travis
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Brad & Melissa Lystad [mailto:sailor@...]
>Sent: Monday, April 12, 1999 10:14 PM
>To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
>Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Re: (no subject)
>
>
>From: "Brad & Melissa Lystad" <sailor@...>
>
>Hehe....Ya, Sneak can be DAMN valuable. I had a buddy running around
>Blackburrow, and he fell into that Tree Pit Trap. You know the one, it
>drops you JUST outside the attack radius of several nasties. He used his
>Sneak, and Hide, to walk right out. If you work on it, and train in it,
you
>too can have remarkable success.
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Josh Hall <phule@...>
>To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com <Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com>
>Date: Monday, April 12, 1999 5:41 PM
>Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Re: (no subject)
>
>
>>From: Josh Hall <phule@...>
>>
>>
>>
>>TRAVISL wrote:
>>>
>>> Do these skills ever go "up" at all?
>>
>>What skills?
>>
>>> Also, has anyone noticed that sometimes the "Sneak" skill just doesn't
>>> work? You hit Sneak and you continue to walk/run at normal speed? Then
>it
>>> becomes available to use it again and you try again etc. Sooner or
later
>it
>>> "works."
>>
>>When you move at half speed, it's working.
>>
>>> I've had aggressive monsters run right past me while I was sneaking,
only
>to
>>> have them see me on other occasions. Same monsters.
>>
>>Sneak does not equate to invisibility or anything approaching such I
>>fear.
>>If anyone here has had any good experiences with it, I'd love to hear
>>them, otherwise, as far as I can tell, it's pretty useless.
>>
>>------------------------------------------------------------------------

>>http://www.ONElist.com

>Internet!
>>
